column4: awk '{print $1}' screen -ls | grep DALnet <---- it says cannot open screen (no such file of directory)
Perhaps you want `screen -ls | awk...'?
Can I use the output from awk to another command?
Yes. `screen -ls | awk '{print $1}' | grep DALnet' should do what6 you want.
screen -ls | grep DALnet | cut -f1 -d '.' | kill awk '{print $1}' <--- This is what I'm trying...
I need to kill the process
screen -ls | grep DALnet | cut -f1 -d '.' | kill awk '{print $1}' -  <--- Like this?
That won't work.
Okay, that works, thanks :)
Great :)
You've used quotes within the quotes.
Escape the quotes around the braces with a backslash.
It says alias }/` not found
That's a forward slash.
I tried the other slash and it's showing more errors
http://www.nomorepasting.com/getpaste.php?pasteid=8807
Can you post the entire command you're using?
alias killDAL='screen -ls | grep DALnet | tail -1 | cut -f1 -d \'.\' | kill `awk \'{print $1}\'`'
Hm, possibly try using double quotes where you're using single quotes within the command.
Oh, that works :D
Great!
